thread.title: Why is Rockies' Dinger now the Indians avatar?
thread.title_full: Why is Rockies' Dinger now the Indians avatar?

author: Deb Stanley
title: Why is Rockies' Dinger now the Indians avatar?
text:
12:51 PM, Oct 20, 2015 54 mins ago Previous Next Copyright 2015 Scripps Media, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Dinger, the purple triceratops mascot of the Rockies, greets a small-size fan at Coors Field on opening day 2014. Copyright 2014 Scripps Media, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
The Cleveland Indians tweets are looking like the Colorado Rockies this week. That's because they lost a bet. 
Sunday, the Cleveland Indians made a friendly wager with the Colorado Rockies on the Broncos-Browns game suggesting the loser change their Twitter avatar to the opposing teams mascot. Hey @Rockies -- friendly wager on today's @Browns / @Broncos game? Loser changes AVI to mascot emoji. Deal? pic.twitter.com/nkZTYD25ak — Cleveland Indians (@Indians) October 18, 2015 
When the Browns lost, the Indians posted a video on their Twitter account showing their unhappiness. — Cleveland Indians (@Indians) October 18, 2015 
The Indians Twitter account is now sporting a purple dinosaur, but Dinger will likely disappear Tuesday afternoon.
